content.description: The beta-2 adrenergic receptor is a membrane-bound protein that regulates several cellular processes, including the synthesis and breakdown of glycogen. The receptor binds specifically to the hormone epinephrine. The binding of epinephrine to the beta-2 adrenergic receptor triggers a signal transduction cascade that controls glycogen synthesis and breakdown in the cell. A simplified model of the signal transduction cascade is represented in Figure 1.
content.question: Figure 1. A simplified model of the signal transduction cascade triggered by epinephrine binding to the beta-2 adrenergic receptor Which of the following outcomes will most likely result from the inactivation of the beta-2 adrenergic receptor?

choices.label: The cellular concentration of cyclic <math alttext="A M P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>AMP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> will increase.
The enzymatic activity of protein kinase A will increase.
The activation of glycogen phosphorylase will increase.
The rate of glycogen synthesis in the cell will increase.

content.answer: The rate of glycogen synthesis in the cell will increase.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
